Portal 2 is a unique masterpiece, an instant classic in gaming that will stay for years to come. It's slightly dated when it comes to graphics, but brings the first person puzzle mechanics started in Portal 1 and takes them to a whole new level. The voice acting is phenomenal, and it will keep a smile on your face throughout the whole game.

This sequel is infinitely better than its predecessor. Its cunning, its clever, and full of mystery and intrigue. It's a must play to anyone who calls himself a gamer, and my own personal GOTY for 2010.

Puede que hayáis escuchado de parte de alguno de esos tipos de Black Mesa que Aperture Science solo es un grupo de aficionados dedicados a hacer cortinas de baño. Nada mas lejos de la realidad, los tíos de las batas dicen que este juego es la prueba que necesitáis para saber que las palabras de Black Mesa no tienen mas crédito que vuestras carteras y que sus experimentos no valen más que chip en una patata.
Comprad el juego y recordad pasar por la cámara de descontaminación si comenzáis a notar náuseas.

Qué decir de este juego.... es una unión de jugabilidad, diversión, buen argumento y bastante buen apartado gráfico, uniéndolo todo en una deliciosa combinación que hará que ames Portal 2. Un juego para disfrutar desde el principio hasta el fin.

Y, como no, comparándolo con Portal, le mejora en prácticamente todos los aspectos, ya sea en cuanto a longitud del modo single, en cuanto al apartado gráfico (obviously thing is obvious) y en cuanto a jugabilidad, incluyendo más elementos que pueden dar juego a los diferentes puzles que incluye el juego.

Además, Portal 2 ha sabido introducir un modo multijugador a la perfección, con un cooperativo que promete muuuucho tiempo adicional de juego a lo que en Portal quedaba limitado al entretenimiento en solitario.

Recomiendo este juego para.... ¿todos? ¿cualquiera que se considere gamer? Sí...
Buy this now

Se avete voglia di spremere le meningi senza rinunciare all'azione... Se avete voglia di qualcosa di originale, senza rinunciare a basi classiche... Se avete voglia di farvi prendere per i fondelli da voci robotiche, senza perdere la stima in voi stessi... Portal 2 fa per voi!!!

This is one of the greatest games of all time. THe puzzles are well thought-out, the dialogue is hilarious, and the overall gameplay experience is great. The game is not overly long, but there is a cooperative multiplayer mode which is also good fun and adds several hours of lifespan to the product. I bought it when it came out for $50 and felt it was money well spent.

Jumping off of the success of Portal 1, Portal 2 here actually prides it self on what amounts to an absolutely FANTASTIC story. As goes with 1, pretty much 70% of it is tutorial, although it isn't as seamless as it was and you can actually feel it more this time around since the first tests each seem short at first and not really a new test to be solved, but actually trying to get you to learn the new mechanic. Where you had a free and open area to try out different ways to solve a challenge, now you have a certain number of pieces to a puzzle that you try and find the right order they go in. If you want straight puzzles and lots of 'em, they're in the multiplayer, which is also AMAZING, and with its own separate storyline. The new elements all add so much more to the game and ways any test can be completed. I would have gladly paid double for this game with how immersive the story is and of course the absolute flawlessness of the gameplay, not to mention it is purely fun.

Portal 2 is a one of the very rare major titles that don't fall into any of the major genres, combining the originality of the best independent games with production values and scope of a AAA title.

As the sequel of the brilliant original, it remains a first person puzzle game that will be accessible for anyone who's ever played an FPS, but will mainly challenge your wits, rather than reflexes. Compared to the original, it's bigger, it's got other kinds of Aperture technologies than just the portal gun, there is much more narrative about the rise and fall of Aperture Science and it has co-op, which enables for puzzles with a whole new dimension. And it's all done quite brilliantly, probably making this my GOTY.
